name: esdoc/hal/config/hal.config.es6
Role
description: A standard or scoped role used when RBAC is turned on.

name: ADMINISTRATOR
description: Has all permissions except cannot read or write resources related to the administrative audit logging system.

name: AUDITOR
description: Can read anything. Can only modify the resources related to the administrative audit logging system.

name: DEPLOYER
description:
Like a Maintainer, but with permission to modify persistent configuration constrained to resources that are
considered to be "application resources". A deployment is an application resource. The messaging server is not.
Items like datasources and JMS destinations are not considered to be application resources by default, but this
is configurable.

name: MAINTAINER
description: Operator permissions, plus can modify the persistent configuration.

name: MONITOR
description: A read-only role. Cannot modify any resource.

name: OPERATOR
description:
Monitor permissions, plus can modify runtime state, but cannot modify anything that ends up in the persistent
configuration. Could, for example, restart a server.

name: SUPER_USER
description: Has all permissions. Equivalent to a JBoss AS 7 administrator.

return.description: the unique ID of this role.
true if this is a standard role, false otherwise.
true if this is a scoped role, false otherwise.
the base role if this is a scoped role, null otherwise.
the scopes if this is a scoped role, an empty array otherwise.
a string representation of this role.

name: Environment
description: Instance holding information about the console and its environment.

return.description: true for standalone mode, false otherwise.
the name of the domain controller (DC).
true if SSO is used, false otherwise.

name: User
description: Holds information about an user.

return.description: true if this user belongs to the role SuperUser, false otherwise.
true if this user belongs to the role Administrator, false otherwise.

name: InstanceInfo
description:
Contains information about the server instance the console is connected to or loaded from (taken from the root
resource).

name: Roles
description: Provides access to all standard and scoped roles.

return.description: scoped roles or an empty array if no scoped roles are defined.

params.name: id
params.description: The unique ID of the role.

return.description: the role for that ID or null if no such role was found.

name: Endpoints
description: Provides access to the endpoints used in HAL.

return.description: the endpoint used to execute management operations.
the endpoint used for file uploads.

true if the console is served from a WildFly / EAP instance, false if it runs standalone and
connected to an arbitrary management endpoint.

name: Version
description: Represents a version consisting of a major, minor and micro part.

name: valueOf
description: Creates a new version as a result of parsing the specified version string.

name: esdoc/hal/core/hal.core.es6
content:
/** * Represents an extension written in JavaScript. */ class Extension { /** * Creates a header extension. * * @param {string} name A unique name of the extension. * @param {string} title The title of the menu item in the header. * @param {function()} entryPoint The entrypoint of the header extension. * * @return {Extension} the extension which can be registered using the {@link ExtensionRegistry}. */ static header(name, title, entryPoint) {} /** * Creates a footer extension. * * @param {string} name A unique name of the extension. * @param {string} title The title of the menu item in the footer. * @param {function()} entryPoint The entrypoint of the footer extension. * * @return {Extension} the extension which can be registered using the {@link ExtensionRegistry}. */ static footer(name, title, entryPoint) {} } /** * Contains generic CRUD methods to add, read, update and remove (singleton) resources. Some methods just execute the * underlying DMR operations, other methods also interact with the user by showing (confirmation) dialogs. */ class CrudOperations { /** * Opens an add-resource dialog for the given resource type. The dialog contains fields for all required request * properties. When clicking "Add", a new resource is added using the specified address. After the resource has been * added a success message is displayed and the callback is executed. * * @param {string} type The human readable resource type used in the dialog header and success message. * @param {AddressTemplate|ResourceAddress|string} address The address for the add operation. Must end in <resource type>=*. * @param {string[]} attributes Additional attributes (besides the required attributes) which should be part of the * add-resource dialog. May be null or empty. * @param {function(name: string, address: ResourceAddress)} callback The callback executed after the resource has been added. */ addDialog(type, address, attributes, callback) {} /** * Executes an add operation using the specified name and payload. After the resource has been added a success * message is displayed and the callback is executed. * * @param {string} type The human readable resource type used in the dialog header and success message. * @param {string} name The resource name which is part of the add operation. * @param {AddressTemplate|ResourceAddress|string} address The address for the add operation. Must end in <resource type>=*. * @param {ModelNode} payload The optional payload of the add operation (may be null or undefined). * @param {function(name: string, address: ResourceAddress)} callback The callback executed after the resource has been added. */ add(type, name, address, payload, callback) {} /** * Opens an add-resource dialog for the given singleton resource type. The dialog contains fields for all required * request properties. When clicking "Add", a new singleton resource is added using the specified address template. * After the singleton resource has been added a success message is displayed and the callback is executed. * * @param {string} type The human readable resource type used in the dialog header and success message. * @param {Object} address The address for the add operation. Must end in <resource type>=<resource * name>. * @param {string[]} attributes Additional attributes (besides the required attributes) which should be part of the * add-resource dialog. May be null or empty. * @param {function(address: ResourceAddress)} callback The callback executed after the singleton resource has been added. */ addSingletonDialog(type, address, attributes, callback) {} /** * Executes an add operation using the specified payload. After the resource has been added a success message is * displayed and the callback is executed. * * @param {string} type The human readable resource type used in the dialog header and success message. * @param {AddressTemplate|ResourceAddress|string} address The address for the add operation. Must end in <resource type>=<resource * name>. * @param {ModelNode} payload The optional payload of the add operation (may be null or undefined). * @param {function(address: ResourceAddress)} callback The callback executed after the singleton resource has been added. */ addSingleton(type, address, payload, callback) {} /** * Executes a read-resource operation on the specified address and passes the result to the callback. * * @param {AddressTemplate|ResourceAddress|string} address The address for the read-resource operation operation. * @param {function(result: ModelNode)} callback The callback which gets the result of the read-resource operation. */ read(address, callback) {} /** * Executes a recursive read-resource operation on the specified address and passes the result to the callback. * * @param {AddressTemplate|ResourceAddress|string} address The address for the read-resource operation operation. * @param {function(result: ModelNode)} callback The callback which gets the result of the read-resource operation. */ readRecursive(address, callback) {} /** * Executes a read-children-resources operation on the specified address and passes the result as {@link Property} * array to the callback. * * @param {AddressTemplate|ResourceAddress|string} address The address for the read-children-resources operation. * @param {string} childType The child resource type. * @param {function(children: Property[])} callback The callback which gets the result of the read-children-resources operation. */ readChildren(address, childType, callback) {} /** * Writes the changed values to the specified resource. After the resource has been saved a standard success message * is displayed and the callback is executed. If the change set is empty, a warning message is displayed and the * callback is executed. * * @param {string} type The human readable resource type used in the success message. * @param {string} name The resource name. * @param {AddressTemplate|ResourceAddress|string} address The address for the operation. * @param {{key: string, value: object}} changeSet A key-value map containing the changes to the resource. * @param {function()} callback The callback executed after the resource has been saved. */ save(type, name, address, changeSet, callback) {} /** * Writes the changed values to the specified singleton resource. After the resource has been saved a standard * success message is displayed and the callback is executed. If the change set is empty, a warning message is * displayed and the callback is executed. * * @param {string} type The human readable resource type used in the success message. * @param {AddressTemplate|ResourceAddress|string} address The address for the operation. * @param {{key: string, value: object}} changeSet A key-value map containing the changes to the resource. * @param {function()} callback The callback executed after the singleton resource has been saved. */ saveSingleton(type, address, changeSet, callback) {} /** * Shows a confirmation dialog and removes the resource if confirmed by the user. After the resource has been * removed a success message is displayed and the callback is executed. * * @param {string} type The human readable resource type used in the success message. * @param {string} name The resource name. * @param {AddressTemplate|ResourceAddress|string} address The address for the operation. * @param {function()} callback The callback executed after the resource has been removed. */ remove(type, name, address, callback) {} /** * Shows a confirmation dialog and removes the singleton resource if confirmed by the user. After the resource has * been removed a success message is displayed and the callback is executed. * * @param {string} type The human readable resource type used in the success message. * @param {AddressTemplate|ResourceAddress|string} address The address for the operation. * @param {function()} callback The callback executed after the resource has been removed. */ removeSingleton(type, address, callback) {} } /** * Provides access to all important classes. Acts as an entry point for the JavaScript API. */ class Core { /** * @return {CrudOperations} crud operations */ get crud() {} /** * @return {Dispatcher} dispatcher */ get dispatcher() {} /** * @return {Endpoints} endpoints */ get endpoints() {} /** * @return {Environment} environment */ get environment() {} /** * @return {ExtensionRegistry} extension registry */ get extensionRegistry() {} /** * @return {MetadataProcessor} metadata processor */ get metadataProcessor() {} /** * @return {MetadataRegistry} metadata registry */ get metadataRegistry() {} /** * @return {StatementContext} statement context */ get statementContext() {} /** * @return {Core} the singleton core instance. */ static getInstance() {} /** * Creates and returns a dialog builder using the specified title. * * @param {string} title The dialog title. * * @return {DialogBuilder} a builder to create dialogs */ dialog(title) {} /** * Shows an error message. * * @param {string} message The error message. */ error(message) {} /** * Returns a new form builder for a {@link ModelNode}. * * @param {Metadata|AddressTemplate|string} meta The metadata for the form. * * @return {FormBuilder} the form builder */ form(meta) {} /** * Shows an info message. * * @param {string} message The info message. */ info(message) {} /** * Returns a new form builder for a {@link NamedNode}. * * @param {Metadata|AddressTemplate|string} meta The metadata for the form. * * @return {FormBuilder} the form builder */ namedForm(meta) {} /** * Returns a new table builder for a {@link NamedNode}. * * @param {Metadata|AddressTemplate|string} meta The metadata for the table. * * @return {TableBuilder} the table builder */ namedTable(meta) {} /** * Returns a new operation builder. * * @param {AddressTemplate|ResourceAddress|string} address The address. * @param {string} name The operation name. * * @return {OperationBuilder} the operation builder */ operation(address, name) {} /** * Shows a success message. * * @param {string} message The success message. */ success(message) {} /** * Returns a new table builder for a {@link ModelNode}. * * @param {Object} meta The metadata for the table. * * @return {TableBuilder} the table builder */ table(meta) {} /** * Shows a warning message. * * @param {string} message The warning message. */ warning(message) {} } /** * Registry to manage HAL extensions written in JavaScript. */ class ExtensionRegistry { /** * Registers an extension. Use this method to register your extension. *

* If the extension is already registered, this method will do nothing. * * @param {Extension} extension the extension to register. */ register(extension) {} /** * Injects the script and stylesheets of an extension. This method is used during development. Normally you don't * have to call this method. * * @param {string} script the extension's script. * @param {string[]} stylesheets an optional list of stylesheets. */ inject(script, stylesheets) {} }

name: Extension
description: Represents an extension written in JavaScript.

name: header
description: Creates a header extension.

params.name: name
params.description: A unique name of the extension.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the menu item in the header.

params.name: entryPoint
params.description: The entrypoint of the header extension.

return.description: the extension which can be registered using the {@link ExtensionRegistry}.

name: footer
description: Creates a footer extension.

params.name: name
params.description: A unique name of the extension.

params.name: title
params.description: The title of the menu item in the footer.

params.name: entryPoint
params.description: The entrypoint of the footer extension.

return.description: the extension which can be registered using the {@link ExtensionRegistry}.

name: CrudOperations
description:
Contains generic CRUD methods to add, read, update and remove (singleton) resources. Some methods just execute the
underlying DMR operations, other methods also interact with the user by showing (confirmation) dialogs.

name: addDialog
description:
Opens an add-resource dialog for the given resource type. The dialog contains fields for all required request
properties. When clicking "Add", a new resource is added using the specified address. After the resource has been
added a success message is displayed and the callback is executed.

params.name: type
params.description: The human readable resource type used in the dialog header and success message.

params.name: address
params.description: The address for the add operation. Must end in <resource type>=*.

params.name: attributes
params.description:
Additional attributes (besides the required attributes) which should be part of the
add-resource dialog. May be null or empty.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback executed after the resource has been added.

name: add
description:
Executes an add operation using the specified name and payload. After the resource has been added a success
message is displayed and the callback is executed.

params.name: type
params.description: The human readable resource type used in the dialog header and success message.

params.name: name
params.description: The resource name which is part of the add operation.

params.name: address
params.description: The address for the add operation. Must end in <resource type>=*.

params.name: payload
params.description: The optional payload of the add operation (may be null or undefined).

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback executed after the resource has been added.

name: addSingletonDialog
description:
Opens an add-resource dialog for the given singleton resource type. The dialog contains fields for all required
request properties. When clicking "Add", a new singleton resource is added using the specified address template.
After the singleton resource has been added a success message is displayed and the callback is executed.

params.name: type
params.description: The human readable resource type used in the dialog header and success message.

params.name: address
params.description: The address for the add operation. Must end in <resource type>=<resource name>.

params.name: attributes
params.description:
Additional attributes (besides the required attributes) which should be part of the
add-resource dialog. May be null or empty.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback executed after the singleton resource has been added.

name: addSingleton
description:
Executes an add operation using the specified payload. After the resource has been added a success message is
displayed and the callback is executed.

params.name: type
params.description: The human readable resource type used in the dialog header and success message.

params.name: address
params.description: The address for the add operation. Must end in <resource type>=<resource name>.

params.name: payload
params.description: The optional payload of the add operation (may be null or undefined).

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback executed after the singleton resource has been added.

name: read
description: Executes a read-resource operation on the specified address and passes the result to the callback.

params.name: address
params.description: The address for the read-resource operation operation.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback which gets the result of the read-resource operation.

name: readRecursive
description: Executes a recursive read-resource operation on the specified address and passes the result to the callback.

params.name: address
params.description: The address for the read-resource operation operation.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback which gets the result of the read-resource operation.

name: readChildren
description:
Executes a read-children-resources operation on the specified address and passes the result as {@link Property}
array to the callback.

params.name: address
params.description: The address for the read-children-resources operation.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback which gets the result of the read-children-resources operation.

name: save
description:
Writes the changed values to the specified resource. After the resource has been saved a standard success message
is displayed and the callback is executed. If the change set is empty, a warning message is displayed and the
callback is executed.

params.name: type
params.description: The human readable resource type used in the success message.

params.name: changeSet
params.description: A key-value map containing the changes to the resource.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback executed after the resource has been saved.

name: saveSingleton
description:
Writes the changed values to the specified singleton resource. After the resource has been saved a standard
success message is displayed and the callback is executed. If the change set is empty, a warning message is
displayed and the callback is executed.

params.name: type
params.description: The human readable resource type used in the success message.

params.name: changeSet
params.description: A key-value map containing the changes to the resource.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback executed after the singleton resource has been saved.

name: remove
description:
Shows a confirmation dialog and removes the resource if confirmed by the user. After the resource has been
removed a success message is displayed and the callback is executed.

params.name: type
params.description: The human readable resource type used in the success message.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback executed after the resource has been removed.

name: removeSingleton
description:
Shows a confirmation dialog and removes the singleton resource if confirmed by the user. After the resource has
been removed a success message is displayed and the callback is executed.

params.name: type
params.description: The human readable resource type used in the success message.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback executed after the resource has been removed.

name: Core
description: Provides access to all important classes. Acts as an entry point for the JavaScript API.

name: dialog
description: Creates and returns a dialog builder using the specified title.

name: error
description: Shows an error message.

name: form
description: Returns a new form builder for a {@link ModelNode}.

name: info
description: Shows an info message.

name: namedForm
description: Returns a new form builder for a {@link NamedNode}.

name: namedTable
description: Returns a new table builder for a {@link NamedNode}.

name: operation
description: Returns a new operation builder.

name: success
description: Shows a success message.

name: table
description: Returns a new table builder for a {@link ModelNode}.

name: warning
description: Shows a warning message.

name: ExtensionRegistry
description: Registry to manage HAL extensions written in JavaScript.

name: register
description:
Registers an extension. Use this method to register your extension.

If the extension is already registered, this method will do nothing.

name: inject
description:
Injects the script and stylesheets of an extension. This method is used during development. Normally you don't
have to call this method.

name: esdoc/hal/dmr/hal.dmr.es6
Dispatcher
description: Executes operations against the management endpoint.

name: executeComposite
description: Executes the specified composite operation.

name: execute
description: Executes the specified operation. The callback contains just the result w/o surrounding nodes like "outcome".

name: Composite
description: Represents a composite operation consisting of n {@link Operation}s.

name: addOperation
description: Adds the specified operation to this composite.

return.description: a string representation of this composite
the string representation of the operation as used in the CLI

name: Property
description: Represents a DMR property.

name: constructor
description: Creates a new property

name: ModelNodeHelper
description:
Static helper methods for dealing with {@link ModelNode}s and {@link NamedNode}s. Some methods accept a path
parameter separated by "/" to get a deeply nested data.

name: failSafeGet
description: Tries to get a deeply nested model node from the specified model node. Nested paths must be separated with "/".

params.name: modelNode
params.description: The model node to read from

return.description: The nested node or an empty / undefined model node

name: failSafeBoolean
description:
Tries to get a deeply nested boolean value from the specified model node. Nested paths must be separated with
"/".

params.name: modelNode
params.description: The model node to read from

name: failSafeList
description: Tries to get a deeply nested node array from the specified model node. Nested paths must be separated with "/".

params.name: modelNode
params.description: The model node to read from

return.description: the model nodes or an empty array

name: failSafePropertyList
description:
Tries to get a deeply nested property array from the specified model node. Nested paths must be separated with
"/".

params.name: modelNode
params.description: The model node to read from

return.description: the properties or an empty array

name: asNamedNodes
description: Turns an properties array into an array of names nodes.

name: ResourceAddress
description:
Represents a fully qualified DMR address ready to be put into a DMR operation. The address consists of 0-n segments
with a name and a value for each segment.

return.description: the value of the first segment or null if this address is empty.
the name of the last segment or null if this address is empty.
the value of the last segment or null if this address is empty.
the parent address or the root address if this address has no parent.

name: addSegment
description: Adds the specified segment to this address.

return.description: this address with the specified segment added

name: addAddress
description: Adds the specified address to this address.

return.description: this address with the specified address added

name: replaceValue
description: Replaces the value in the specified segment

return.description: this address containing the replaced value

name: Operation
description: Represents a DMR operation.

return.description: the string representation of the operation as used in the CLI
the string representation of the operation as used in the CLI

name: ModelNode
description: A dynamic model representation node object.

name: defined
description: Determine whether this node is defined.

return.description: true if this node's value is defined, false otherwise
true if this node has an outcome and the outcome does not equal "success"
the failure description or "No failure-description provided"

name: fromBase64
description: Creates a new node from a base64 encoded string

name: asInt
description:
Get the value of this node as number. Collection types will return the size
of the collection for this value. Other types may attempt a string conversion.

throws.description: IllegalArgumentException if no conversion is possible

name: asBoolean
description:
Get the value of this node as a boolean. Collection types return true for non-empty collections. Numerical types
return true for non-zero values.

throws.description: IllegalArgumentException if no conversion is possible

name: asString
description:
Get the value as a string. This is the literal value of this model node. More than one node type may
yield the same value for this method.

name: asProperty
description:
Get the value of this node as a property. Object values will return a property if there is exactly one
property in the object. List values will return a property if there are exactly two items in the list,
and if the first is convertible to a string.

throws.description: IllegalArgumentException if no conversion is possible

name: asObject
description:
Get a copy of this value as an object. Object values will simply copy themselves.

Property values will return a single-entry object whose key and value are copied from the property key and value.

List values will attempt to interpolate the list into an object by iterating each item, mapping each property into an object entry and otherwise taking pairs of list entries, converting the first to a string, and using the pair of entries as a single object entry. If an object key appears more than once in the source object, the last key takes precedence.

throws.description: IllegalArgumentException if no conversion is possible

name: setNumber
description: Change this node's value to the given value.

name: setBoolean
description: Change this node's value to the given value.

name: setExpression
description: Change this node's value to the given expression value.

name: setString
description: Change this node's value to the given value.

name: setNode
description: Change this node's value to the given value. The value is copied from the parameter.

name: setProperty
description: Change this node's value to the given value.

name: setEmptyList
description: Change this node's value to an empty list.

name: setEmptyObject
description: Change this node's value to an empty object.

name: clear
description: Clear this node's value and change its type to undefined.

name: get
description:
Get the child of this node with the given name. If no such child exists, create it. If the node is undefined, it will be initialized to be of type object.

When called on property values, the name must match the property name.

throws.description: IllegalArgumentException if this node does not support getting a child with the given name

name: add
description:
Add a node to the end of this node's value list and return it. If the node is undefined, it will be initialized
to be of type list.

name: has
description:
Determine whether this node has a child with the given name. Property node types always contain exactly one
value with a key equal to the property name.

return.description: true if there is a (possibly undefined) node at the given key

name: hasDefined
description:
Determine whether this node has a defined child with the given name. Property node types always contain exactly
one value with a key equal to the property name.

return.description: true if there is a node at the given index and its type is not undefined

name: toString
description: Get a human-readable string representation of this model node, formatted nicely (possibly on multiple lines).

name: create
description: Creates a new undefined model node

return.description: this model node as an {@link Property} array
this model node as an array.

name: NamedNode
description: A model node with a name.

return.description: the name of this named node
the model node of this named node
a string representation of this model node

name: CompositeResult
description: Represents the result of a composite operation.

return.description: whether this composite result contains steps
the steps of this composite result

name: OperationBuilder
description: A builder for operations.

name: payload
description: Uses the specified payload for the operation.

name: param
description: Add a parameter to the operation

name: header
description: Add a header to the operation

name: esdoc/hal/meta/hal.meta.es6
AddressTemplate
description:
Template for a DMR address which might contain multiple variable parts. An address template can be defined using the following BNF: 
<address template> ::= "/" | <segment>
<segment>          ::= <tuple> | <segment>"/"<tuple>
<tuple>            ::= <variable> | <key>"="<value>
<variable>         ::= "{"<alpha>"}"
<key>              ::= <alpha>
<value>            ::= <variable> | <alpha> | "*"
<alpha>            ::= <upper> | <lower>
<upper>            ::= "A" | "B" |  | "Z"
<lower>            ::= "a" | "b" |  | "z"
Following variables are supported: - {domain.controller} - {selected.profile} - {selected.group} - {selected.server-config} - {selected.server} To get a fully qualified address from an address template use the method resolve(). For standalone mode the variables will resolve to an empty string. The values of the variables are managed by the {@link StatementContext}.

name: ROOT
description: The root template

return.description: true if this template contains no tokens, false otherwise
the parent address template or the root template
the name of the first segment or null if this address template is empty.
the value of the first segment or null if this address template is empty.
the name of the last segment or null if this address template is empty.
the value of the last segment or null if this address template is empty.

name: of
description: Creates a new address template from an encoded string template.

return.description: the string representation of this address template

name: resolve
description: Resolve this address template against the specified statement context.

params.name: wildcards
params.description:
An optional list of wildcards which are used to resolve any wildcards in this address template
from left to right

return.description: a fully qualified resource address which might be empty, but which does not contain any tokens

name: append
description: Append an address to this addrress template and return a new one.

return.description: a new address template with the specified address added at the end.

name: MetadataRegistry
description: Registry for existing resource {@link Metadata}.

name: contains
description: Checks whether there's a metadata for the specified template.

return.description: true if the registry contains metadata for the given template, false otherwise

name: lookup
description: Returns metadata associated with the specified address template.

return.description: the metadata for the specified template

throws.description: MissingMetadataException if no metadata for the given template exists

name: StatementContext
description:
Contains global state which is updated as you navigate in the console. In standalone mode most of the methods return
null.

name: SecurityContext
description: Represents the RBAC related payload from the read-resource-description operation.

name: READ_ONLY
description: A security context with hardcoded permissions to read resources, write and execute operations are not allowed.

name: RWX
description: A security context with hardcoded permissions to read, write and execute any resource.

return.description: whether the security context is readable
whether the security context is writable

name: MetadataProcessor
description:
Reads resource {@link Metadata} using read-resource-description operations and stores it into the {@link
MetadataRegistry}. If you're sure the metadata is present you can use the {@link MetadataRegistry} instead.

name: lookup
description:
Reads the metadata for the template, stores it in the registry and passes it to the callback. If the metadata is
already in the registry it's passed directly to the callback.

params.name: callback
params.description: The callback which receives the metadata.

name: ResourceDescription
description: Contains the resource and attribute descriptions from the read-resource-description operation.

return.description: the request properties of the add operation

name: Metadata
description: Simple data struct for common metadata. Used to keep the method signatures small and tidy.

name: esdoc/hal/ui/hal.ui.es6
Form
description:
A form bound to a model using well defined states and operations. The form contains a list of form items which are
used to view and modify the attributes of the model. Form item can be bound or unbound. Bound form items show the
attributes of the model (text input, check boxes or select boxes), whereas unbound form items have no relation to
the model (static text or buttons).

name: view
description: Takes the specified model and updates the read-only state with the values from the model.

name: clear
description: Clears this form by removing the model reference and by clearing all form fields.

name: edit
description: Takes the specified model and populates the editing state with the values from the model.

name: save
description:
Validates the form and its fields and upon successful validation persists the changes to the model and
calls the save callback.

name: cancel
description: Cancels any modifications to the model.

name: closeOnly
description: Shortcut for a dialog with one 'Close' button.

name: saveCancel
description:
Shortcut for a dialog with a 'Save' and 'Cancel' button. Clicking on save will execute the specified
callback.

name: Dialog
description:
A modal dialog with optional secondary and primary buttons. Only one dialog can be open at a time. The buttons can be placed on the left or the right side. Each button has a callback. The callback is either a {@link Callback} which always closes the dialog or a {@link ResultCallback} with a boolean return value. A value of {@code true} indicates that the dialog should be closed whereas {@code false} keeps the dialog open. You can add as many buttons as you like, but only one of them should be the primary button.

There are convenience methods to add primary and secondary buttons which come with pre-defined placements. If you want to define the placement by yourself use negative numbers to place the buttons on the left side and positive numbers for the right side. On each side the buttons are ordered according to the placement.

name: FormBuilder
description:
Builder useful to automatically inspect the read-resource-description and associate the
attributes (by calling: include, customFormItem). Creates the required form items and help texts.

name: addOnly
description:
Use this flag if you just want to use the form to add model nodes. This will create a form with an {@link AddOnlyStateMachine}.

The attributes will be taken from the {@code ATTRIBUTES} child node.

name: fromRequestProperties
description:
Use this flag if you just want to use the form to add model nodes. This will create a form with an {@link AddOnlyStateMachine}.

The attributes will be taken from the {@code REQUEST_PROPERTIES} node of the {@code ADD} operation.
